title: Midjourney
content:
{{Short description|Image-generating machine learning model}}

{{Artificial intelligence}}

'''Midjourney''' is an independent research lab that produces a [[Proprietary software|proprietary]] [[artificial intelligence]] program under the same name that creates images from textual descriptions, similar to [[OpenAI]]'s [[DALL-E]] and [[Stable Diffusion]].<ref name="economist2">{{cite news |title=Huge "foundation models" are turbo-charging AI progress |url=https://www.economist.com/interactive/briefing/2022/06/11/huge-foundation-models-are-turbo-charging-ai-progress |newspaper=The Economist |access-date=26 June 2022}}</ref><ref name="theconversation">{{cite web |last1=Hertzmann |first1=Aaron |title=Give this AI a few words of description and it produces a stunning image – but is it art? |url=https://theconversation.com/give-this-ai-a-few-words-of-description-and-it-produces-a-stunning-image-but-is-it-art-184363 |website=The Conversation |access-date=26 June 2022 |language=en}}</ref> The tool is currently in [[open beta]], which it entered on July 12, 2022.<ref name="beta">{{Cite tweet |number=1547108864788553729 |user=midjourney |title=We're officially moving to open-beta! Join now at https://discord.gg/midjourney. **Please read our directions carefully** or check out our detailed how-to guides here: https://midjourney.gitbook.io/docs. Most importantly, have fun! |date=July 12, 2022 |access-date=August 31, 2022}}</ref> The Midjourney team is led by David Holz, who co-founded [[Leap Motion]].<ref name="viceInsideMidjourney">{{cite news |last1=Rose |first1=Janus |title=Inside Midjourney, The Generative Art AI That Rivals DALL-E |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/wxn5wn/inside-midjourney-the-generative-art-ai-that-rivals-dall-e |publisher=[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]] |date=July 18, 2022}}</ref> Holz told ''[[The Register]]'' in August 2022 that the company was already profitable.<ref name="theregister-2022-08">{{cite news |last1=Claburn |first1=Thomas |title=Holz, founder of AI art service Midjourney, on future images |url=https://www.theregister.com/2022/08/01/david_holz_midjourney/ |access-date=September 5, 2022 |work=The Register |date=August 1, 2022 |language=en}}</ref> Users create artwork with Midjourney using [[Discord]] bot commands.<ref name="pcworld-2022-07">{{cite news |last1=Hachman |first1=Mark |title=Midjourney's enthralling AI art generator goes live for everyone |url=https://www.pcworld.com/article/820518/midjourneys-ai-art-goes-live-for-everyone.html |access-date=September 5, 2022 |work=PCWorld |date=July 26, 2022 |language=en}}</ref>

==History==
Midjourney first entered open beta on July 12, 2022.<ref name="beta"/>

The company has been working on improving its algorithms, releasing new versions every few months. Version 2 of their algorithm was launched in April 2022 <ref>{{citation|title=Tweet from @Midjourney|url=https://twitter.com/midjourney/status/1516138949219024898}}</ref> and version 3 in July.<ref>{{citation|title=Tweet from @Midjourney|url=https://twitter.com/midjourney/status/1551560891254001664}}</ref> On November 10th, 2022, the alpha iteration of version 4 was released to users.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Midjourney v4 greatly improves the award-winning image creation AI |url=https://www.techspot.com/news/96619-midjourney-v4-greatly-improves-award-winning-image-creation.html |access-date=2022-11-17 |website=TechSpot |language=en-US}}</ref>

==Functionality==
Midjourney is currently only accessible through a Discord bot on their official Discord, by direct messaging the bot, or by inviting the bot to a third party server. To generate images, users use the {{code|/imagine}} command and type in a prompt; the bot then returns an image. Midjourney is also working on a web interface.{{cn|date=October 2022}} 

==Uses==

Founder David Holz says he sees artists as customers, not competitors of Midjourney. Holz told ''The Register'' that artists use Midjourney for [[rapid prototyping]] of artistic concepts to show to clients before starting work themselves.<ref name="theregister-2022-08" /> Because Midjourney's [[Training, validation, and test data sets|training set]] may include copyrighted artists' works{{Citation needed|date=December 2022}}, some artists have accused Midjourney of devaluing original creative work.<ref name="vice-2022-08" /> Midjourney's terms of service includes a [[Digital Millennium Copyright Act|DMCA]] takedown policy, allowing artists to request their work to be removed from the set, if they believe [[copyright infringement]] to be evident.<ref>https://midjourney.gitbook.io/docs/terms-of-service {{bare URL inline|date=December 2022}}</ref>

The advertising industry has been quick to embrace AI tools such as Midjourney, DALL-E, and Stable Diffusion, among others. The tools, which enable advertisers to create original content and brainstorm ideas quickly are providing new opportunities such as, “custom ads created for individuals, a new way to create special effects, or even making e-commerce advertising more efficient,” according to ''[[Ad Age]]''.{{Citation needed|date=September 2022}}

===Notable usage and controversy===
The program was used by the British magazine ''[[The Economist]]'' to create the front cover for an issue in June 2022.<ref name="economist">{{cite news |title=How a computer designed this week's cover |url=https://www.economist.com/news/2022/06/11/how-a-computer-designed-this-weeks-cover |access-date=26 June 2022 |newspaper=The Economist}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Liu |first1=Gloria |title=DALL-E 2 Made Its First Magazine Cover |url=https://www.cosmopolitan.com/lifestyle/a40314356/dall-e-2-artificial-intelligence-cover/ |website=Cosmopolitan |access-date=26 June 2022 |date=21 June 2022}}</ref> In Italy, the leading newspaper ''[[Corriere della Sera]]'' published a comic created with Midjourney by writer Vanni Santoni in August 2022.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.corriere.it/la-lettura/22_agosto_26/su-la-lettura-highsmith-inedita-citta-europee-trasformazione-af21cf38-2522-11ed-9c55-2dc9b0266fc8.shtml | title=Su «La Lettura», Highsmith inedita e le città che mutano | newspaper=Corriere della Sera }}</ref> Charlie Warzel used Midjourney to generate two images of [[Alex Jones]] for Warzel's newsletter in ''[[The Atlantic]]''. The use of an AI-generated cover was criticised by people who felt it was taking jobs from artists. Warzel called his action a "mistake" in an article about his decision to use generated images.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-08-17 |title=I Went Viral in the Bad Way |url=https://newsletters.theatlantic.com/galaxy-brain/62fc502abcbd490021afea1e/twitter-viral-outrage-ai-art/ |access-date=2022-08-31 |website=Galaxy Brain |language=en}}</ref> ''[[Last Week Tonight with John Oliver]]'' included a 10-minute segment on Midjourney in an episode broadcast in August 2022.<ref name="sfgate-2022-08">{{cite news |last1=SFGATE |first1=Dan Gentile |title=John Oliver is weirdly popular on this SF-based AI image app |url=https://www.sfgate.com/streaming/article/hbo-john-oliver-ai-midjourney-17374718.php |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=SFGATE |date=August 16, 2022}}</ref><ref name="ew-2022-08">{{cite news |last1=Brathwaite |first1=Lester Fabian |title=John Oliver marries a cabbage in ceremony officiated by Steve Buscemi on 'Last Week Tonight' |url=https://ew.com/tv/john-oliver-marries-cabbage-steve-buscemi/ |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=EW.com |date=August 29, 2022 |language=en}}</ref>

A Midjourney image called ''Théâtre d'Opéra Spatial'' won first place in the digital art competition at the 2022 [[Colorado State Fair]]. Jason Allen, who wrote the [[Prompt engineering|prompt]] that led Midjourney to generate the image, printed the image onto a canvas and entered it into the competition using the name "Jason M. Allen via Midjourney". Other digital artists were upset by the news.<ref name="vice-2022-08">{{cite news |last1=Gault |first1=Matthew |title=An AI-Generated Artwork Won First Place at a State Fair Fine Arts Competition, and Artists Are Pissed |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/bvmvqm/an-ai-generated-artwork-won-first-place-at-a-state-fair-fine-arts-competition-and-artists-are-pissed |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=Motherboard |publisher=Vice |date=August 31, 2022 |language=en}}</ref> Allen was unapologetic, insisting that he followed the competition's rules. The two category judges were unaware that Midjourney used AI to generate images, although they later said that had they known this, they would have awarded Allen the top prize anyway.<ref name="nytimes-2022-09">{{cite news |last1=Roose |first1=Kevin |title=An A.I.-Generated Picture Won an Art Prize. Artists Aren't Happy. |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/02/technology/ai-artificial-intelligence-artists.html |access-date=September 2, 2022 |work=The New York Times |date=September 2, 2022}}</ref>

In December 2022, Midjourney was used to create an AI-generated [[Children's literature|children's book]] in the span of a weekend. Titled ''Alice and Sparkle'', the book features a young girl who builds a robot that becomes self-aware. The creator, Ammaar Reeshi, spent hours tweaking Midjourney prompts, rejecting hundreds of generated results to ultimately choose 13 illustrations for the book.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Stokel-Walker |first=Chris |date=13 December 2022 |title=A Tech Worker Is Selling A Children's Book He Made Using AI. Professional Illustrators Are Pissed. |url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/chrisstokelwalker/tech-worker-ai-childrens-book-angers-illustrators |access-date=19 December 2022 |website=[[BuzzFeed]] News}}</ref> Both the product and process drew criticism: “the main problem... is that it was trained off of artists’ work. It’s our creations, our distinct styles that we created, that we did not consent to being used," one artist wrote.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Popli |first=Nic |date=14 December 2022 |title=He Used AI to Publish a Children's Book in a Weekend. Artists Are Not Happy About It |url=https://time.com/6240569/ai-childrens-book-alice-and-sparkle-artists-unhappy/ |access-date=19 December 2022 |magazine=[[Time (magazine)]]}}</ref>

==Photo gallery==

This gallery shows examples of the quality of the AI engine among the various versions of Midjourney.  All images were generated using the same text prompt. All images were generated using the same commands.<!--

If you are here to change all the images, please see talk page first (dec 29, 2022) -->
<gallery heights="400px" widths="400px" perrow="3">
File:Midjourney V1 Avocado Chair.png|thumb|Avocado chair prompt, Midjourney version 1
File:Avo v2.png|thumb|Avocado chair prompt, Midjourney version 2
File:Avo v3.png|thumb|Avocado chair prompt, Midjourney version 3
File:Avo v4.png|thumb|Avocado chair prompt, Midjourney version 4
</gallery>
